newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq unveils Web-based market service.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq unveils Web-based market service.

text.p: The Nasdaq Stock Market said Wednesday it unveiled Nasdaq Online, a Web-based service for market information.
The service is available exclusively to chief executives, chief financial officers, investor relations directors and board members of companies listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market.

The online service will allow clients to compare stock performances, access exclusive real-time data on trading activity, see institutional ownership information, consider comparative company performance measures and view analysts' forecasts and insights, Nasdaq said.
The Nasdaq Stock Market is an independent subsidiary of the National Association of Securities Dealers Inc.
